skill.name: sympy
skill.description: Use this skill when working with symbolic mathematics in Python. This skill should be used for symbolic computation tasks including solving equations algebraically, performing calculus operations (derivatives, integrals, limits), manipulating algebraic expressions, working with matrices symbolically, physics calculations, number theory problems, geometry computations, and generating executable code from mathematical expressions. Apply this skill when the user needs exact symbolic results rather than numerical approximations, or when working with mathematical formulas that contain variables and parameters.
skill.summary: Use this skill when working with symbolic mathematics in Python. This skill should be used for symbo...

security_audit.summary: All 497 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This skill is pure documentation for the SymPy symbolic mathematics library. The detected patterns (backticks, imports, eval, file operations) are legitimate documentation elements: markdown code formatting, Python code examples showing SymPy features like lambdify and srepr, and file export for mathematical results. No malicious behavior present.

content.user_title: Solve symbolic math problems with SymPy
content.value_statement: Need exact mathematical results instead of numerical approximations. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for symbolic algebra, calculus, equation solving, matrix operations, and physics calculations using Python SymPy library.
actual_capabilities: Solve algebraic and differential equations symbolically
Perform calculus operations: derivatives, integrals, limits, series expansion
Work with matrices: eigenvalues, determinants, linear systems
Generate executable code from mathematical expressions (Python, C, Fortran)
Calculate physics problems: mechanics, quantum, vectors, units
Explore advanced topics: number theory, geometry, combinatorics, statistics
limitations: Symbolic computation can be slow for very complex expressions
Not all integrals have closed-form symbolic solutions
Requires understanding of symbolic mathematics concepts
Numerical libraries needed for high-performance computing

use_cases.title: Derive equations of motion
use_cases.description: Set up Lagrangian mechanics problems and derive equations of motion symbolically

use_cases.title: Symbolic feature engineering
use_cases.description: Create symbolic expressions for mathematical transformations before numerical evaluation

use_cases.title: Learn symbolic computation
use_cases.description: Explore step-by-step mathematical derivations, simplifications, and solution verification

prompt_templates.title: Basic equation solving
prompt_templates.prompt: Solve the quadratic equation x^2 - 5x + 6 = 0 and verify the solutions

prompt_templates.title: Calculus operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the derivative of sin(x^2) and then compute the definite integral from 0 to pi

prompt_templates.title: Matrix operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of matrix [[1, 2], [2, 1]]

prompt_templates.title: Code generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the expression x^2 + sin(x) to a NumPy function for numerical evaluation

output: The equation has two real solutions

best_practices: Define symbols with assumptions (positive=True, integer=True) to improve simplification
Use lambdify() to create fast numerical functions from symbolic expressions
Use Rational() or S() for exact arithmetic instead of floating-point numbers
Choose appropriate solvers: solveset for algebra, linsolve for linear systems, dsolve for ODEs
anti_patterns: Using floating-point numbers (0.5) instead of Rational(1, 2) for exact results
Using subs() and evalf() in loops instead of lambdify() for performance
Forgetting to define symbols with symbols() before using them
Skipping assumptions when working with constrained variables (positive, real, integer)

faq.question: What is symbolic vs numerical computation?
faq.answer: SymPy maintains exact symbolic expressions like sqrt(2) while numerical methods approximate as 1.414. Symbolic gives exact results.

faq.question: When should I use lambdify()?
faq.answer: Use lambdify() when you need to evaluate a symbolic expression many times with numerical data. It converts expressions to fast NumPy functions.

faq.question: How do I solve differential equations?
faq.answer: Use dsolve() from sympy. Define your function with symbols('f', cls=Function), then call dsolve(Derivative(f(x), x) - f(x), f(x)).

faq.question: What are symbol assumptions?
faq.answer: Assumptions like positive=True, real=True, integer=True help SymPy simplify expressions correctly. sqrt(x**2) returns x only if x is positive.

faq.question: How do I generate C/Fortran code?
faq.answer: Use sympy.utilities.codegen.codegen() to generate compilable C or Fortran code from symbolic expressions for performance-critical applications.

faq.question: Can SymPy handle matrices with symbolic entries?
faq.answer: Yes, SymPy supports symbolic matrices. You can compute determinants, eigenvalues, inverses, and solve systems with symbols as matrix elements.
